channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Paraguay Loves Mickey, the Cartoon Mouse. Disney Doesn’t.
item.description: Mickey, a homegrown food-packaging company, is famous for facing down Disney in Paraguay’s Supreme Court. As the family business turns 90, why is it s...

item.title: Intel reaches deal to make chips for US military
item.description: The secretive program, called Secure Enclave, seeks to establish production for advanced chips with military and intelligence applications.

item.title: Sexual Abuse Allegations Against Abbé Pierre Shatter His Legacy

item.title: Ex-Jefferies fund manager faces criminal investigation over alleged Ponzi-like scam
item.description: The government probe marks an escalation in scrutiny of Chirico’s management of 352.

item.title: Sentence for Paramedic Convicted in Elijah McClain’s Death Is Reduced to Probation
item.description: Peter Cichuniec was sentenced in March to five years in prison. On Friday, a judge reduced the sentence because of “unusual and extenuating circumstan...

item.title: Tracking Investigations In Eric Adams’s Orbit
item.description: Several federal corruption inquiries have reached into the world of Mayor Eric Adams of New York, who faces re-election next year. Here is a closer lo...

item.title: Investors’ bets on the outlook for oil prices has never been this bearish
item.description: Hedge funds turned net bearish on Brent crude for the first time on record as concerns about an oversupply of oil hammer futures prices.

item.title: Sweeping Iraq Raid Killed 4 ISIS Leaders
item.description: The U.S. military said those killed in a joint assault by U.S. and Iraqi forces last month included the group’s top commander in Iraq and its leading ...

item.title: Typhoon Yagi Leaves at Least 110 Dead in Myanmar
item.description: Rescuers in Myanmar reported finding bodies swept away by the powerful storm, which left a trail of destruction there and in neighboring countries.

item.title: Wamco loses Russell Bond Fund as fallout over star trader probe escalates
item.description: Wamco, which has been losing clients for years, was hit by a fresh wave of investor redemptions due to a probe of its co-chief investment officer.

item.title: Boeing strike could cost $3.5 billion if it drags on as workers feel ‘a lot of bad blood’
item.description: "They went 10 years without getting much of a raise at all — they are trying to make up for lost time."
